At that time, Bodhisattva Mind King addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
The buddhas, tathÄgatas, expound asaá¹ƒkhyeya, immeasurable, boundless, unequaled, incalculable, inconceivable, immeasurable, inexpressible, and inexpressibly inexpressible.
World-Honored One!
What is asaá¹ƒkhyeya up to inexpressibly inexpressible?
The Buddha told Bodhisattva Mind King:
Excellent, excellent!
Good man!
You now wish to cause all worlds to enter the meaning of the number known by the buddhas and ask the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One.
Good man!
Listen carefully, listen carefully!
Contemplate it well!
I will explain it for you.
At that time, Bodhisattva Mind King respectfully accepted the teaching.
The Buddha said:
Good man!

It is also inexpressible that these inexpressible [numbers] are multiplied by one inexpressible [number].
This is called the second ground.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke in verse for Mind King Bodhisattva, saying:
The inexpressible is filled with all inexpressibles,ğŸ”½And in all the inexpressibly many eons,
The inexpressible cannot be exhausted.ğŸ”½All the inexpressibly many buddha lands
Are all ground to dust,ğŸ”½And in each particle of dust there are inexpressibly many lands,
And so it is with all of them.ğŸ”½In these inexpressibly many buddha lands,
In a single thought they are ground to dust, inexpressibly many,ğŸ”½And in each thought they are ground to dust in the same way,
For inexpressibly many eons it is always so.ğŸ”½In these particles of dust there are inexpressibly many lands,
And it is even more difficult to say that these lands are particles of dust.ğŸ”½Using the method of counting inexpressibly many times,
For inexpressibly many eons it is counted in this way.
Using these dust motes to count eons, one dust mote representing a hundred thousand unspeakable eons,
For that many eons praising a single Samantabhadra, one cannot exhaust his merits and virtues.
In a single tiny hair-tip, there are unspeakable numbers of Samantabhadras,
All hair-tips are also like this, pervading the Dharma realm in this way.
The number of lands in a single hair-tip is unspeakable and immeasurable,
Filling all space with hair-tips, each location having lands like this.
The lands in those hair-tips, with immeasurable different kinds of abodes,
Have unspeakable different kinds of lands, and unspeakable lands of the same kind.
In unspeakable hair-tips, there are unspeakable pure lands,
With unspeakable various adornments and unspeakable various marvels.
At each and every tip of a hair, they expound the names of innumerable buddhas,
And each and every name has tathÄgatas, all of whom are innumerable and indescribable.
At each and every body of the buddhas, they manifest innumerable pores,
And at each and every pore, they manifest innumerable forms and appearances.
The innumerable pores all emit innumerable lights,
And in each and every light, there are innumerable lotus flowers.
In each and every lotus flower, there are innumerable petals,
And in the innumerable lotus flowers and petals, each manifests innumerable forms and appearances.
In those innumerable forms, they again manifest innumerable petals,
And in the petals there are innumerable lights, and in the lights there are innumerable forms and appearances.
In this indescribable form, each manifests indescribable light,ğŸ”½In the light, indescribable moons are manifested, and in the moons, indescribable moons are further manifested.
In those indescribable moons, each manifests indescribable light,
And in each of those lights, indescribable suns are manifested.
In those indescribable suns, each manifests indescribable forms,
And in each of those forms, indescribable lights are further manifested.
In each of those lights, indescribable lion thrones are manifested,
Each adornment is indescribable, and each light is indescribable.
The wondrous forms in the light are indescribable, and the pure light in the forms is indescribable,
In each of those pure lights, various wondrous lights are further manifested.
This light further manifests various lights, inexpressibly and indescribably unspeakable,
Within these various lights, each manifests a wondrous jewel like Mount Sumeru.
In each light, the manifested jewels are inexpressibly and indescribably unspeakable,
Each such Mount Sumeru-like wondrous jewel manifests inexpressibly unspeakable buddha-lands.
Exhausting the jewels of Mount Sumeru without remainder, manifesting buddha-lands all like this,
Taking one buddha-land and reducing it to dust, the form and appearance of each particle is inexpressibly unspeakable.
The lands reduced to dust particles each have form and appearance, inexpressibly and indescribably unspeakable,
Such various dust particle appearances all emit inexpressibly unspeakable lights.
The buddhas manifested in the lights are inexpressibly unspeakable, the Dharma spoken by the buddhas is inexpressibly unspeakable,
The wondrous verses within the Dharma are inexpressibly unspeakable, hearing the verses and gaining understanding is inexpressibly unspeakable.
Inconceivable explanations moment by moment,
manifesting all future buddhas, always expounding the Dharma without end.
Each buddha-dharma is inconceivable, its various purities are inconceivable,
emitting wondrous sounds is inconceivable, turning the wheel of the true Dharma is inconceivable.
In each of those Dharma wheels, expounding sÅ«tras is inconceivable;ğŸ”½in each of those sÅ«tras, discerning the Dharma gates is inconceivable;
in each of those Dharma gates, again expounding the dharmas is inconceivable;
in each of those dharmas, taming sentient beings is inconceivable.
Or else, in a single hair-tip, always abiding for inconceivable eons,
as in a single hair-tip, so it is in all, the number of eons abiding in each being the same.
Their minds are unobstructed and indescribable, and they transform into buddhas indescribably;
Each of those transformed tathÄgatas further manifests transformations indescribably.
Those buddhas' dharma bodies are indescribable, and their emanated bodies are indescribable;
Their adornments are immeasurable and indescribable, and they go to the ten directions indescribably;
They travel through the lands indescribably, and observe sentient beings indescribably;
They purify sentient beings indescribably, and tame sentient beings indescribably.
Those adornments are indescribable, and those spiritual powers are indescribable;ğŸ”½Those self-mastery is indescribable, and those spiritual transformations are indescribable.
Those spiritual powers are indescribable, and those realms are indescribable;
Those empowerments are indescribable, and those abodes in the world are indescribable.
The pure true aspect is inexpressible, and the sutras expounded are also inexpressible.ğŸ”½In each and every sutra, the Dharma gates expounded are also inexpressible.
In each and every Dharma gate, the various dharmas expounded are also inexpressible.
In each and every one of those dharmas, the certainties contained are also inexpressible.
In each and every one of those certainties, the taming of sentient beings is also inexpressible.
The same kind of dharmas that cannot be expressed in words, the same kind of minds that cannot be expressed in words,
The different kind of dharmas that cannot be expressed in words, the different kind of minds that cannot be expressed in words,
The different kind of faculties that cannot be expressed in words, the different kind of languages that cannot be expressed in words,
Moment by moment, in all the places of practice, the taming of sentient beings is also inexpressible.
The spiritual transformations are inexpressible, the manifestations are also inexpressible,
The eons within them are indescribable, and the distinctions within them are also indescribable.
Bodhisattvas can all distinguish and explain them, but those who are clear in calculation cannot discern them.
In the tip of a single hair are large and small lands, defiled and pure lands, coarse and fine lands.
All of these are indescribable, yet each can be clearly distinguished.
If a single land is shattered into dust particles, those dust particles are immeasurable and indescribable.

The number of such dust particles is the number of lands, all coming together at the tip of a single hair.ğŸ”½These lands are indescribable, yet coming together at the tip of a hair there is no crowding.
Without causing the tip of the hair to expand, those lands all come together.
Within them are all the lands, their shapes as they were originally, without confusion.
Just as one land is not confused with the others, all lands are like this.
The realm of space has no boundaries, and all are laid out, filling the tips of hairs,
In this way, the lands at the tips of hairs, the bodhisattva can speak of in a single thought.ğŸ”½In a single tiny pore,
incalculable lands enter in sequence,
The pore can contain those lands, but the lands cannot pervade the pore.
The number of eons of entering is incalculable, the number of eons of receiving is incalculable,
Dwelling in this array, all eons are unable to speak of it.
Having thus received and abided in this, the realms are incalculable,
The skillful means of entering are incalculable, the actions after entering are incalculable,
The clarity of the mental faculty is incalculable, roaming through the directions is incalculable,
The courageous and vigorous effort is incalculable, the sovereign spiritual transformations are incalculable,
All thoughts are indescribable, all great vows are indescribable,
All realms are indescribable, all thorough understandings are indescribable,
Pure physical actions are indescribable, pure verbal actions are indescribable,
Pure mental actions are indescribable, pure faith and understanding are indescribable,
Pure wondrous cognition is indescribable, pure wondrous discernment is indescribable,
Realizing all true characteristics is indescribable, severing all doubts and confusion is indescribable,
Escaping birth and death is indescribable, transcending to the correct stage is indescribable,
The profound samÄdhi is indescribable, penetrating all is indescribable,
All sentient beings are indescribable, all buddha lands are indescribable,
Knowing the bodies of sentient beings is indescribable, knowing their mental pleasures is indescribable,

Knowing that the results of their karma are indescribable, knowing that their mental understanding is indescribable,ğŸ”½Knowing that their categories are indescribable, knowing that their natures are indescribable,
Knowing that their embodiments are indescribable, knowing that their birthplaces are indescribable,
Knowing that their births are indescribable, knowing that after birth they are indescribable,
Knowing that their understanding is indescribable, knowing that their directions are indescribable,
Knowing that their speech is indescribable, knowing that their activities are indescribable.
The bodhisattvas' great compassion like this benefits all worlds,
Universally manifesting their bodies indescribably, entering buddha lands indescribably,
Seeing bodhisattvas indescribably, giving rise to wisdom indescribably,
Requesting the true Dharma indescribably, proclaiming the Buddha's teachings indescribably.
Manifesting various bodies beyond description, going to various lands beyond description,
Displaying spiritual powers beyond description, pervading the ten directions beyond description,
Manifesting bodies everywhere beyond description, attending to the buddhas beyond description,
Making various offerings beyond description, various immeasurable things beyond description,
Pure precious things beyond description, supreme lotus flowers beyond description,
Supreme fragrant garlands beyond description, making offerings to the tathÄgatas beyond description,
Pure faith beyond description, supreme understanding beyond description,
Superior aspiration beyond description, respectfully attending to the buddhas beyond description,
Cultivating giving beyond description, the mind in the past beyond description,
Giving to all who seek beyond description, giving everything beyond description,
The purity of upholding precepts is indescribable, the purity of mind and thought is indescribable,
Praising the buddhas is indescribable, loving and delighting in the true Dharma is indescribable,
Accomplishing all forms of patience is indescribable, the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas is indescribable,
Being fully endowed with tranquility is indescribable, abiding in the stage of tranquility is indescribable,
Arising with great zeal is indescribable, the past of one's mind is indescribable,
The irreversible mind is indescribable, the unshakable mind is indescribable,
The treasury of all concentrations is indescribable, contemplating all dharmas is indescribable,ğŸ”½Tranquilly abiding in concentration is indescribable, penetrating all meditations is indescribable,
Wisdom and penetration are indescribable, mastery of samÄdhi is indescribable,
Penetrating all dharmas is indescribable, clearly seeing all buddhas is indescribable,
Cultivating immeasurable practices is indescribable, making vast vows is indescribable,
The profound realm is indescribable, the pure Dharma doors are indescribable,
The Dharma power of bodhisattvas is indescribable, the Dharma abodes of bodhisattvas are indescribable,
Their correct mindfulness is indescribable, their Dharma realms are indescribable,
Cultivating skillful means and wisdom is indescribable, studying profound wisdom is indescribable,
Immeasurable wisdom is indescribable, ultimate wisdom is indescribable,
Their Dharma wisdom is indescribable, their pure Dharma wheels are indescribable,
Their great Dharma clouds are indescribable, their great Dharma rains are indescribable,
Their spiritual powers are indescribable, their skillful means are indescribable,
Entering the wisdom of emptiness and tranquility is indescribable, their continuous mindfulness is indescribable,
The immeasurable methods of practice are inexpressible, always abiding in the inexpressible moment by moment,
The oceans of buddha-lands are inexpressible, able to go to them all is inexpressible,
The distinctions of the lands are inexpressible, the various kinds of purity are inexpressible,
The distinctions in adornments are inexpressible, the boundless forms and appearances are inexpressible,
The various kinds of interweaving are inexpressible, the various kinds of wondrous characteristics are inexpressible,
The pure buddha-lands are inexpressible, the defiled worlds are inexpressible,
Understanding sentient beings is inexpressible, knowing their dispositions is inexpressible,
Knowing their karmic retributions is inexpressible, knowing their mental activities is inexpressible,
Knowing their faculties and natures is inexpressible, knowing their understanding and desires is inexpressible,
Defilement and purity are inexpressible, observing and taming is inexpressible,
The freely transforming spiritual powers are indescribable, manifesting various bodies are indescribable,
Cultivating diligent practice is indescribable, liberating sentient beings is indescribable,
Displaying spiritual transformations is indescribable, emitting great light is indescribable,
Various colors and forms are indescribable, causing sentient beings to be purified is indescribable,
Each pore is indescribable, emitting light nets are indescribable,
The light nets manifesting colors are indescribable, universally illuminating buddha lands are indescribable,
Valorous fearlessness is indescribable, skillful means are indescribable,
Subduing sentient beings is indescribable, causing them to escape birth and death is indescribable,
Pure physical actions are indescribable, pure verbal actions are indescribable,
Boundless mental actions are indescribable, supreme wonderful practices are indescribable,
The accomplishment of the treasure of wisdom is indescribable, deeply entering the dharma realm is indescribable,
The dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s of the bodhisattvas are indescribable, being able to skillfully cultivate and study is indescribable,
The sounds of the wise ones are indescribable, the purity of the sounds is indescribable,
The correct mindfulness of reality is indescribable, enlightening sentient beings is indescribable,
Being replete with deportment is indescribable, pure practice is indescribable,
Accomplishing fearlessness is indescribable, taming the world is indescribable,
The assembly of Buddha's disciples is indescribable, pure and excellent practices are indescribable,
Praising the buddhas is indescribable, praising without end is indescribable,
The guides of the world are indescribable, expounding and praising is indescribable,
Those bodhisattvas are indescribable, their pure merits are indescribable,
The limits of those are indescribable, and being able to abide within them is also indescribable.
Abiding within wisdom is indescribable, and abiding in the end of all kalpas is also indescribable.
Rejoicing in the buddhas is indescribable, and wisdom that is impartial is also indescribable.
Skillfully entering all dharmas is indescribable, and being unobstructed in the Dharma is also indescribable.
The three times are like empty space and indescribable, and the wisdom of the three times is also indescribable.
Thoroughly penetrating the three times is indescribable, and abiding in wisdom is also indescribable.
Supreme and wondrous practices are indescribable, and immeasurable great vows are also indescribable.
Pure great vows are indescribable, and accomplishing enlightenment is also indescribable.
The enlightenment of the buddhas is indescribable, and giving rise to wisdom is also indescribable.
Discerning meanings and principles is indescribable, and knowing all dharmas is also indescribable.
Inconceivable is the adornment and purification of the Buddha-lands, and the cultivation of the various powers;
Inconceivable is the long-term cultivation, and the instant realization and understanding;
Inconceivable is the mastery of the Buddhas, and the extensive exposition of the true Dharma;
Inconceivable are the various spiritual powers, and the manifestation in the world;
Inconceivable is the pure Dharma wheel, and the courageous ability to turn it;
Inconceivable is the various expositions, and the compassion for the world.
In inconceivable kalpas, praising the inconceivable merits,
Inconceivable kalpas may still come to an end, but the inconceivable merits are inexhaustible.
The inconceivable TathÄgatas, with their inconceivable tongues,
Praise the inconceivable merits of the Buddha, for inconceivable kalpas they cannot be exhausted.
All sentient beings in the ten directions, all simultaneously attaining perfect enlightenment,
Within this, a single Buddha is able to manifest all bodies beyond description.
Within this indescribable, a single body manifests tongues beyond description;
Within this indescribable, a single tongue manifests sounds beyond description;
Within this indescribable, a single sound abides for eons beyond description.
As one, so are all Buddhas; as one, so are all bodies;
As one, so are all heads; as one, so are all tongues;
As one, so are all sounds, constantly praising the Buddha for eons beyond description;
Eons beyond description may still come to an end, but praising the Buddha's merits can never be exhausted.
In a single dust mote, they can all be present, with lotus worlds beyond description,
In each lotus world, there are indescribable TathÄgatas Vairocana.
Extending throughout the Dharma realm, in all the dust motes therein,
The number of worlds forming, abiding, and decaying is indescribable.
In a single dust mote, there are boundless limits, with immeasurable lands all coming into it,
The distinctions of the ten directions are indescribable, and the distribution of the ocean of lands is indescribable.
In each land, there is a TathÄgata, with lifespans and eons beyond description,
The practices of the Buddhas are indescribable, and the profound and wondrous Dharma is indescribable,
The spiritual powers and great strength are indescribable, and unobstructed wisdom is indescribable,
Entering the hair pores is indescribable, and the causes and conditions of the hair pores are indescribable.
The ten powers are inconceivable, and so is the realization of enlightenment;
Entering the pure dharma realm is inconceivable, and so is attaining the profound treasury of wisdom.ğŸ”½The various numbers are inconceivable, and so is the complete understanding of all of them;
The various forms and sizes are inconceivable, and so is the thorough understanding of all of them.
The various samadhis are inconceivable, and so is the ability to abide in them for eons;
In the presence of the inconceivable buddhas, the practice of purity is inconceivable.
Attaining the inconceivable unobstructed mind, going to the inconceivable ten directions,
Displaying inconceivable spiritual powers, the inconceivable practice has no bounds;
Going to the inconceivable many lands, thoroughly understanding the inconceivable buddhas,
The inconceivable courageous vigor, the inconceivable wisdom penetration.
In the Dharma, neither practicing nor not practicing, entering all objects that cannot be spoken of,
For innumerable great eons, always roaming the unspeakable ten directions.
Skillful means and wisdom are unspeakable, true wisdom is unspeakable,
Wisdom of spiritual powers is unspeakable, manifesting moment by moment is unspeakable.
In the unspeakable dharmas of all Buddhas, each and every one is understood and spoken of,
Able to attain enlightenment in one instant, or to enter realization in various times.
Buddha lands on a hair-tip are unspeakable, Buddha lands in a particle of dust are unspeakable,
In this way, going to all Buddha lands, seeing the TathÄgatas is unspeakable.
Penetrating the one reality is unspeakable, skillfully entering the Buddha lineage is unspeakable,
All Buddha lands are unspeakable, able to go to them all and attain enlightenment.
The lands, sentient beings, and buddhas, their natures and differences cannot be spoken of,
Thus the three times have no bounds, the bodhisattvas all clearly see them.
Chapter 31: Lifespan At that time, Bodhisattva MahÄsattva Mind King addressed the bodhisattvas in the assembly, saying:
Buddha's disciples!
One kalpa in this SahÄ world of ÅšÄkyamuni Buddha's realm is one day and night in the SukhÄvatÄ« world of AmitÄbha Buddha's realm;
One kalpa in the SukhÄvatÄ« world is one day and night in the Vajra Firm Buddha's realm in the Kaá¹£Äya Banner world;
One kalpa in the Kaá¹£Äya Banner world is one day and night in the Sound Wheel of Irreversibility world of the Buddha of Well-Adorned Light and Blossoming Lotus's realm;
One kalpa in the Sound Wheel of Irreversibility world is one day and night in the Dharma Banner Buddha's realm in the Stainless world;
One kalpa in the world of Separation from Defilement is one day and night in the Buddha land of Lion Buddha in the world of Good Lamp;
One kalpa in the world of Good Lamp is one day and night in the Buddha land of Treasury of Light Buddha in the world of Wonderful Light;
One kalpa in the world of Wonderful Light is one day and night in the Buddha land of Buddha Blooming Lotus Flower of Dharma Light in the world of Difficult to Surpass;
One kalpa in the world of Difficult to Surpass is one day and night in the Buddha land of Buddha Light of All Spiritual Powers in the world of Adorned Wisdom;
One kalpa in the world of Adorned Wisdom is one day and night in the Buddha land of Buddha Moon Wisdom in the world of Mirror Light.
Buddha's disciples!

In this way, after passing through a million asaá¹ƒkhyeya worlds, one kalpa in the last world is one day and night in the Buddha land of Virtuous Superior Buddha in the world of Supreme Lotus Flower, filled with Samantabhadra Bodhisattva and other great bodhisattvas who practice together.
